page.title: 18Dismantled Railway
page.content: My Uncle Tim's house is called Badgers Bend. It is on the dismantled railway. It used to be the{station. Where the train used to stop there is a long greenhouse and the{platform is grass land. It is very big. The Freshwater, Yarmouth and Newport Railway opened a time for goods in{1888}and for passengers in {1889.}Terrier No.3, No.13, Carisbrooke and No.30 Shorwell were some of the steam locomotives on this line. The line was{closed}by British Rail in {1953.}The dismantled railway in easily recognisabile in late spring for the white hawthorn blossom along its hedges.
